questions.questionText: Which Indian city hosted the G20 Summit in 2023?
questions.explanation: New Delhi hosted the G20 Summit in September 2023, where India held the G20 Presidency. The summit brought together leaders from 20 major economies.

questions.questionText: What is the name of India's third lunar mission that successfully landed on the Moon's south pole in 2023?
questions.explanation: Chandrayaan-3 successfully landed on the Moon's south pole on August 23, 2023, making India the first country to achieve this feat and the fourth country to land on the Moon.

questions.questionText: Which is India's highest civilian award?
questions.explanation: Bharat Ratna is India's highest civilian award, given for exceptional service in any field. Param Vir Chakra is the highest military decoration, not civilian.

questions.questionText: Who won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 along with Malala Yousafzai?
questions.explanation: Kailash Satyarthi, an Indian child rights activist, won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 jointly with Malala Yousafzai for their struggle against child exploitation.

questions.questionText: Neeraj Chopra won India's first Olympic gold medal in athletics in which event?
questions.explanation: Neeraj Chopra won the gold medal in Javelin Throw at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics (held in 2021), becoming the first Indian to win an Olympic gold in athletics.

questions.questionText: Which Indian film won the Academy Award for Best Original Song in 2023?
questions.explanation: The song 'Naatu Naatu' from the Telugu film RRR won the Oscar for Best Original Song at the 95th Academy Awards in 2023, composed by M.M. Keeravani.

questions.questionText: Who is the author of the book 'Wings of Fire'?
questions.explanation: 'Wings of Fire' is the autobiography of Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, the former President of India and renowned scientist, co-written with Arun Tiwari.

questions.questionText: In which year did India host the Cricket World Cup (ODI) and win the championship?
questions.explanation: India hosted and won the ICC Cricket World Cup (ODI) in 2011, defeating Sri Lanka in the final at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium. MS Dhoni was the captain.

questions.explanation: BRICS stands for Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa. It is an association of five major emerging economies working together on economic and political cooperation.

questions.questionText: Who is the current Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) as of 2024?
questions.explanation: Shaktikanta Das has been serving as the Governor of RBI since December 2018. He is the 25th Governor of the Reserve Bank of India.

questions.questionText: Which country hosted the FIFA World Cup 2022?
questions.explanation: Qatar hosted the FIFA World Cup 2022, which was held from November to December 2022. Argentina won the championship, defeating France in the final.

questions.questionText: Param Vir Chakra is awarded for gallantry during which type of service?
questions.explanation: Param Vir Chakra is India's highest military decoration awarded for acts of conspicuous gallantry during wartime. Ashok Chakra is the peacetime equivalent.

questions.questionText: Which organization awards the Booker Prize for literature?
questions.explanation: The Booker Prize is awarded annually by the Booker Prize Foundation to the best novel written in English and published in the UK or Ireland.

questions.questionText: Dronacharya Award is given for excellence in which field?
questions.explanation: The Dronacharya Award is given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports to honor eminent coaches who have successfully trained sportspersons or teams.

questions.questionText: What is the theme of International Yoga Day?
questions.explanation: International Yoga Day is celebrated on June 21st every year. The theme varies yearly, but 'Yoga for Humanity' was the theme for 2022, emphasizing yoga's role in global well-being.

questions.questionText: Who was the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal?
questions.explanation: Karnam Malleswari won a bronze medal in weightlifting at the 2000 Sydney Olympics, becoming the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal.

questions.questionText: Which Indian state recently became the first to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)?
questions.explanation: Uttarakhand became the first state in independent India to implement the Uniform Civil Code in 2024, aiming to have common laws for marriage, divorce, and inheritance for all citizens.

questions.questionText: The United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP28) in 2023 was hosted by which country?
questions.explanation: COP28 (28th Conference of Parties) was hosted by the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in Dubai from November to December 2023, focusing on climate action and renewable energy transitions.
